en: Okay, so it’s not really day one million, and I’m not sure how liberal I was with exaggerations in the books.
zh: 好吧，其實不是真的第一百萬天，我不知道我以前寫書時是多麼隨心所欲地使用誇張的修辭手法。

en: Derek (it’s actually Eric, but I’ve come to think of him as a Derek) told me this morning it’s been eight months since I checked in.
zh: 德里克（實際上是艾瑞克，但我總覺得他是德里克）今天上午告訴我我住進療養院已經八個月了，我算了一些，是999000天，不到100萬。

en: Still, it feels like I’ve been here forever.
zh: 但我也覺得我已經在這裏住了100萬天了，而且會永遠住下去。

en: Today is a Jerry is Jerry day.
zh: 今天是傑瑞清醒的好日子。

en: Jerry has Alzheimer’s—check.
zh: 傑瑞患有阿爾茨海默病——檢查正確。

en: Jerry used to be a crime writer—check.
zh: 傑瑞以前是一個犯罪小說家——檢查正確。

en: Jerry knows he shouldn’t trust Derek—check.
zh: 傑瑞知道他不應該相信德里克——檢查正確。

en: Or Eric—check.
zh: 哦不，是艾瑞克——檢查正確。

en: Jerry is making a checklist—check.
zh: 傑瑞正在寫檢查清單——檢查正確。

en: I’ve been flicking through the journal and seeing I’ve been piling crazy on top of crazy, and among some of those entries is evidence that Henry has been coming out to play.
zh: 我一直在寫日記，看到我瘋狂狀態的巔峰是什麼樣子，其中一些語句可以看作是亨利佔據我身體的證據。

en: I’ve been having conversations with him.
zh: 我一直在與他交談，我們倆談天說地。

en: There are two points here, Future Me, that I want to make.
zh: 未來我想要成為的傑瑞，有兩點需要強調一下。

en: The first is to stop trusting Eric. Let me put that in big capital letters. DON’T TRUST ERIC.
zh: 第一，不要相信艾瑞克，我要加粗放大地寫出來：不要相信艾瑞克。

en: I came into my room earlier and found him elbows deep in my drawer. I think he was looking for my journal.
zh: 我之前走進房間時，發現他在我的抽屜里翻找著什麼。

en: I asked him what he was doing. He said he was tidying up.
zh: 我問他在做什麼，他說他正在收拾。

en: Henry thinks he’s lying. Henry thinks there’s an ulterior motive for Eric wanting you to write in the journal, and Henry does, after all, deal in ulterior motives (most of the characters he creates have one).
zh: 亨利認為他在撒謊，他認為艾瑞克巴不得你寫日記是出於某種不可告人的動機，亨利恰恰善於識別某些心懷鬼胎的動機（他塑造的大多數人物形象都包藏禍心）。

en: In this case the motive is Eric stealing my ideas because he wants to be a writer.
zh: 可以懷疑，艾瑞克的動機是竊取我的靈感，因為他想要成為一個作家。

en: One thing I can remember clearly from my life of crime (writing) is the amount of people who tell me they want to write a book. It’s one of those professions everybody thinks they can do, and I always wanted to say to a lawyer I’ve been thinking about trying a case or to a surgeon I’ve been thinking about performing a heart transplant, as if their job is no more challenging than mine.
zh: 我清楚地記得我的犯罪（創作）生涯，總有一些人向我表示他們想要寫書出版，他們都認為他們可以從事這個職業。

en: And the reason, according to them, they haven’t written that book yet?
zh: 這樣說的話，他們沒有寫成書的原因是什麼呢？

en: Time.
zh: 時間。

en: It’s always that they don’t have time, but they’ll make it.
zh: 他們總是沒有時間，否則他們一定會成功的。

en: How hard can it be?
zh: 能有多難呢？

en: Eric is writing a book—and at least Eric is putting in the time, he’s said he writes a few hours every night, making it a passion as well as a hobby, and that’s something I always respect, and for that I wish him all the best.
zh: 艾瑞克正在寫書——至少艾瑞克正在為此投入時間，他說他每天晚上要寫好幾個小時，充滿著澎湃的激|情，將其視作一種愛好，對此我一直非常尊重。

en: However, he has once committed what I’ve always thought of as the cardinal sin, and that’s to ask Where do you get your ideas?, as if I order a box online every year and have an assistant weed out the bad ones.
zh: 因此，我祝他一切順利。不過，他也曾犯過嚴重過錯，至少我一直這麼認為。他問我：「你是從哪裡獲得靈感的？」就像我每年在網上訂購一盒靈感，還有助理幫我剔除劣質的似的。

en: I’ve told him Write what you know, because there is nothing truer when it comes to the job of making stuff up, but Eric wants to write what I know.
zh: 我就告訴他：「寫你所熟悉的。」因為只要是杜撰和編造的，就沒有什麼是真實的。但艾瑞克一直想寫只有我才知道的，這就是他一直在找我日記的原因。

en: Sometimes on the days I remember who I am, I wonder if it’s the writing that made me this way—all those crazy people running around inside my head—some of that crazy was bound to rub off on me, wasn’t it?
zh: 所以我在想是不是因為寫作才讓我變成了這樣：因為那些瘋狂的人物都在我的腦海里翻騰著，所以有些瘋狂的想法會傳染給我，不是嗎？

en: If Eric wants to be a writer, then let his own crazy do to him what mine did to me.
zh: 如果艾瑞克想成為作家，那他就得像我一樣，讓那些瘋狂的人物傳染給他。

en: If it was a dream, it was the most boring dream I’ve ever had.
zh: 如果這是一場夢，那麼，這是我最無聊的夢了。

en: Since then, I’ve learned that it’s not the first time I’ve wandered. In fact, it’s the second.
zh: 之後我了解到，這並不是我第一次出去遊盪了，算是第二次了。

en: And, right now as I write this, I’m staring at a pair of earrings that are on the table next to me. I found them in my pocket earlier.
zh: 此刻，我一邊寫，一邊盯著旁邊桌子上的一對耳環，我早些時候在我的口袋裡發現了它們。

en: I’ll check later to see if I’ve hidden any high heels in the wardrobe.
zh: 我以後會看看是不是在衣櫃里藏了雙高跟鞋。

en: So now for the second point of two-for Tuesday.
zh: 現在我們來說說星期二的第二件事。

en: Hans asks.
zh: 漢斯說。

en: “So what do we do?”
zh: 「如果沒有用怎麼辦？」

en: “You figured all of this out on your own.”
zh: 「你是自己想出了這一切？」

en: “That’s what I’m telling you.”
zh: 「這就是我要告訴你的。」

en: “Don’t you see, Jerry?
zh: 「你還不明白嗎，傑瑞？

en: You’ve gotten confused again. You’ve—”
zh: 你又犯糊塗了，你又——」

en: “This whole time everybody thought I was sick, but it was just Eric all along.”
zh: 「你們每個人都以為我生病了，但那都是艾瑞克——」

en: “Eric didn’t make you sick, Jerry.”
zh: 「不是艾瑞克讓你生病的，傑瑞。」

en: “Then what do you mean?” “Just lately. All the bad stuff lately is because of him.”
zh: 「最近，最近所有糟糕的事情都是因他而起。」

en: “Jerry—”
“Come to Eric’s house and take a look at what I’ve seen,” he says, “and then tell me I’m making things up.”
zh: 「來艾瑞克家，看看我都看到了什麼。」他說，「然後你再看會不會對我說我在瞎編。」

en: “Jerry—”
“I have to go now,” he says, and then he hangs up.
zh: 「我得掛了，」他說，然後他掛了電話。

en: When all of this is over, he’ll explain everything.
zh: 所有這一切都結束了，他會解釋這一切的。

en: He switches off the phone because it seems the thing to do.
zh: 他關掉手機，這似乎是他現在該做的事情。

en: “So now what?” he asks.
zh: 「我們現在應該幹什麼？」他問。

en: “Now we give it two minutes,” Hans says.
zh: 「等兩分鐘。」漢斯說。

en: They give it two minutes, in which there are no signs of movement, in which neither of the two men talk. Without discussing it, they give it two more minutes.
zh: 他們等了兩分鐘，沒有任何行動的跡象，兩個人都默不作聲，沒有討論，沒有交流，他們足足等了兩分鐘。

en: “Either they’re not moving,” Hans says, “or they were never there to begin with.
zh: 「他們不會行動了。」漢斯說，「或者說，他們還沒有開始行動。

en: But we need to get in there. We have to get that journal.
zh: 但我們要進去了，現在我們必須拿到日記。

en: We can’t exactly go up and knock on the front door, because your bloody neighbor will call the police.
zh: 但我們不能直接走過去敲門，因為你那渾蛋鄰居會打電話報警。

en: We can knock on the back door, and if they’re home, then—”
zh: 我們可以敲後門，如果他們在家，那麼——」

en: “They’re not going to let us in,” Jerry says.
zh: 「他們不會讓我們進去的。」

en: “The owner yesterday thought I was crazy, and today he thinks I’m a killer.”
zh: 傑瑞說，「房主昨天認為我瘋了，今天他會認為我是殺人兇手。」

en: “Then we break in,” Hans says.
zh: 「那我們就闖進去。」漢斯說，「我帶著撬鎖工具。」

en: Jerry reaches into his pocket. He shows Hans the key. “We won’t need them.”
zh: 傑瑞把手伸進口袋，拿出鑰匙給漢斯看：「我們不需撬鎖工具。」

en: “You remember which house is the one behind yours?”
zh: 「你記得你房子後面是哪一家嗎？」

en: “No,” Jerry says, and shakes his head.
zh: 「不記得了。」傑瑞說著搖搖頭，然後他又點點頭，「是的，應該記得，怎麼了？」

en: Hans starts the car.
zh: 漢斯啟動汽車。

en: He takes the next right and comes down the street running parallel with Jerry’s.
zh: 他在下個路口右轉，來到和傑瑞家平行的另一條街道。

en: “They all look the same,” Jerry says, “and I only ever saw it from the back.”
zh: 「看起來都一樣。」傑瑞說，「我只從後面看到過。」

en: Hans gets his phone out. He uses the GPS function and gets a location on where they are. He brings the car to a stop when the blue dot on the screen is in line with Jerry’s house, only with one house between.
zh: 漢斯拿出他的手機，啟用GPS定位功能確定他們的位置，當屏幕上的藍點與傑瑞的房子在一條線上時，他把車停了下來，中間只隔著一幢房子。

en: “That’s the one,” Jerry says.
zh: 「是那個。」傑瑞說。

en: “You sure?”
zh: 「你確定？」

en: “As sure as I can be.”
zh: 「我百分之百確定。」

en: Hans kills the engine.
zh: 漢斯熄滅發動機。

en: “We climb the fence.
zh: 「我們爬上柵欄。

en: We try to figure out if anybody is home. If not, then we go in. If the lights are on, we wait until they’ve gone to bed, then sneak in.
zh: 我們先要確定是否有人在家，如果沒有，那我們就進去；如果燈亮著，我們就等到他們睡覺，再偷偷潛進去。

en: You’re sure you know where the journal is?”
zh: 你確定你知道日記在哪裡嗎？」

en: “I’m positive.”
zh: 「我確定。」

en: “Then let’s go.”
zh: 「那我們走吧。」

en: The house they’re parked outside is a two-story house with a concrete tile roof and a flower bed jammed full of roses that catch at Jerry’s clothes as he passes them.
zh: 他們把車停在外面，眼前的房子是座兩層樓房，屋頂是混凝土瓦，庭院里有一片長滿玫瑰花的花床，他們走過時，花枝鉤住了傑瑞的衣服。

en: They move quietly across the front yard and to the gate that enters the back. It opens quietly, and a few seconds later they’re at the fence line.
zh: 他們躡手躡腳地穿過前花園，來到後面的大門，把它悄無聲息地打開，幾秒鐘后，他們來到柵欄旁。

en: Hans boosts himself up and confirms it’s the right house while Jerry continues to look at the house they’ve just snuck past.
zh: 漢斯踮起腳跟向里張望，確認這就是他們要找的房子了，而傑瑞繼續看著他們剛剛經過的房子。

en: He can see the glow of a TV set, the glow of lights, but nothing to suggest they’ve been heard.
zh: 他可以看到電視機的微光，還有一絲燈光，但沒有跡象表明有人聽到他們偷偷進來。

en: “This is it,” Hans whispers, then drops to the other side.
zh: 「就是這兒。」漢斯低聲道，縱身跳到另一側。

en: Jerry climbs over, landing in a backyard that still feels as though it’s his. Up ahead is where the pool used to be, but now it’s a paved area with a long wooden barbecue table and a pair of outdoor gas heaters. There are no lights on inside the house.
zh: 傑瑞爬過柵欄，落在後院，他感覺這裏依然是他的家，前面曾經是游泳池，但現在已經填平了，擺放著一張長方形木質燒烤桌和兩個室外燃氣加熱器。

en: They reach the deck and the sun lounger where they had left Mrs. Smith.
zh: 他們來到露台上，那裡放著太陽椅，他們上次就是把史密斯太太丟在那裡的。

en: Jerry half expects to see her still lying there, but it also won’t surprise him if she comes storming through the gate waving her hockey stick any second.
zh: 傑瑞有點兒希望看到她仍舊躺在那裡，不過若是她隨時揮舞著曲棍球棒衝進大門的話，他也不會驚訝的。

en: A cat sits outside the door—it stares at him, then shifts its attention to Hans before running away.
zh: 一隻貓坐在門外，它盯著他看了一陣，又看看漢斯，然後跑掉了。

en: Jerry reaches into his pocket for the key. A moment later he has it in the door.
zh: 傑瑞把手伸進口袋拿出鑰匙，然後插|進門鎖。

en: “What if it has an alarm?”
zh: 「要是有警報器該怎麼辦？」

en: Jerry asks, keeping his voice low.
zh: 傑瑞壓低聲音問。

en: “Then we run,” Hans says.
zh: 「那我們就跑。」

en: “Just stay quiet. I can’t tell if they’re not home or if they’re asleep.”
zh: 漢斯說，「保持安靜，我說不准他們是不在家，還是睡著了。」

en: “I thought you could tell these things.”
zh: 「我還以為你對這種事兒一清二楚呢。」

en: “Just open the door.”
zh: 「開你的門。」

en: He slowly opens the door.
zh: 他慢慢推開門。

en: He knows this house. He spent most of his adult life in this house.
zh: 他對這所房子太熟悉了，大部分的成年生活都是在這所房子里度過的。

en: He knows every shape, every flaw, he knows where the floorboards creak, what doors squeak, and he knows where the secrets are buried.
zh: 他熟悉這裏的每一個形狀、每一處缺陷，他知道踩在哪裡的地板、開合哪扇門時會吱吱作響，他知道秘密藏在哪裡，知道那塊隱秘的密室。

en: Or, in this case, the wall they are hidden behind. His heart is already hammering, but when he steps across the threshold into the house it hammers even more, so loud that if there are people asleep upstairs it’ll be his heart that wakes them.
zh: 他的心怦怦直跳，當他跨過門檻進入房屋，它跳得更快了，心跳聲如此之大，要是有人睡在樓上，肯定能將他們驚醒。

en: They close the door behind them and pause and listen, Jerry’s heart louder now, his breathing heavy. There is no beeping keypad. No alarm.
zh: 他們關上身後的門，停下來側耳傾聽，傑瑞的心跳聲更響了，他的呼吸很重，沒有警報器。

en: His hands are sweating.
zh: 他的手心在出汗。

en: He left the key in the lock, otherwise right now it’d most likely be sliding from his fingers onto the floor.
zh: 幸虧他把鑰匙留在鎖上了，不然它很可能會從他的手心裏滑脫，掉到地板上。

en: In his mind he can see Eva upstairs in her bedroom doing her homework, or talking on the phone to one of her school friends.
zh: 在他的腦海里，他可以看到伊娃在樓上的卧室里做家庭作業，或者打電話跟同學聊天。

en: Sandra is in the lounge reading a book, or working on her next court case.
zh: 桑德拉坐在客廳里看書，或在準備下一個案子。

en: Jerry can see himself behind the desk of his office, plugging away at the word count.
zh: 傑瑞可以看到自己坐在寫作房桌子後面，奮筆疾書，寫著一部新小說。

en: He tries to draw in a deep breath, but it catches in his throat, and then it’s like swallowing a golf ball.
zh: 他想深呼吸，但氣息彷彿卡在喉嚨里，吞下去像吞一個高爾夫球。

en: Hans puts a hand on his shoulder and he almost jumps.
zh: 漢斯用手拍拍他的肩膀，他差點兒跳了起來。

en: “Calm down, Jerry,” he says, keeping his voice low.
zh: 「冷靜下來，傑瑞。」

en: “The sooner we get the diary, the sooner we can get out of here.”
zh: 他壓低嗓音說道，「越早找到日記，我們就會越快離開這裏。」

en: His eyes have adjusted somewhat to the dark.
zh: 傑瑞的眼睛逐漸適應了黑暗。

en: “Step where I step,” he says, and then he starts to walk.
zh: 「跟著我走。」他說，開始向里走去。

en: Hans steps where Jerry steps. The furniture makes black holes in the living room.
zh: 漢斯跟著傑瑞向前走，客廳里的傢具如同一個個黑洞。

en: When they reach the hall, he remembers the boards around the door can complain sometimes, so he makes a big show of stepping over them, then a big show of walking down the side of the hallway and not the middle, and the door to the office—his office—is open.
zh: 到達門廳時，他記得門周邊的地板踩著是可以發出聲音的，所以他做一個跨過去的手勢，接著又做了個手勢，示意漢斯沿走廊的邊側走，不要走在中間。寫作房——他的寫作房——的門敞開著，他們走了進去，關上門，與外面的世界隔絕開來，因為房間里裝有隔音層，傑瑞比以往任何時候都寬心些。

en: “Well? Do you think there’s anybody home?” Jerry asks.
zh: 「怎麼樣，你認為家裡有人嗎？」傑瑞問。

en: “I don’t know. I don’t think so.
zh: 「我不知道，我認為沒有。

en: Let’s just get this done,” Hans says, and he takes his cell phone out and uses the light to look around the room.
zh: 我們趕快找日記吧。」漢斯說，他拿出手機，藉著屏幕光環視房間。

en: For a few moments the office is Jerry’s again.
zh: 在這幾分鐘里，寫作房彷彿又是傑瑞的了。

en: His desk, his couch, his bookcase, his framed King Kong Escapes poster on the wall.
zh: 他的辦公桌，他的沙發，他的書櫃，牆上掛著鑲框的《金剛的逆襲》海報。

en: Then he sees all the subtle differences. The books are different. The computer is different.
zh: 不過他還是發現了一些微妙的差異，書和以前不太一樣了，電腦也不一樣。

en: Different knickknacks on the bookcase mixed in with some of his own, different stationary on the desk, a different monitor, the belongings of a different man, belonging to a different life.
zh: 書柜上，他的玩偶中間混合了一些不同的小擺設，辦公桌上有不同的文具、不同的顯示器，這些東西屬於不同的人，來自不同的生活。

en: He wonders why the police didn’t tear up the floors and pull the walls down in search of evidence.
zh: 他不知道警察為什麼沒有掀開地板，推倒牆壁尋找證據。

en: But perhaps they thought the case looked pretty clear cut.
zh: 也許他們認為這個案子其實很簡單。

en: He makes his way past the desk and to the cupboard in the corner of the room. He opens it.
zh: 他走過辦公桌，來到房間角落的櫥櫃前，打開它。

en: Inside are boxes that, if Gary is anything like him, will be full of receipts and bank statements and all the other joys of being taxed in multiple countries that people don’t think about when it comes to being a writer. There’s a set of small plastic drawers full of stationary, a set of headphones hanging from a hook in the wall, a pile of magazines, some reams of paper.
zh: 裏面是幾個盒子，如果加里也像他一樣的話，這裏面應該是收據、銀行賬單和多個國家的徵稅憑據單，人們通常想不到一個作家還會保存這些東西。

en: He starts dragging everything out, hoping he’s going to find the hidden space, hoping it’s not just something from one of his books, like that time, he suddenly remembers, when he went and bought cigarettes.
zh: 他把所有的東西都拉扯出來，希望找到密室開關，但願這不只是他的一本書中描繪過的情節，就像那次那樣出去買了包香煙。

en: He pulls the board away and hands it to Hans, and then . . .
zh: 對面的牆角突然彈出來。他把板子扯下來交給漢斯，然後……

en: He looks. The first thing he sees is a bottle of gin. He gets it out. It’s half-empty.
zh: 首先映入眼帘的是一瓶杜松子酒，他把它拿出來，只有半瓶了。

en: He unscrews the lid and breaths in the aroma, the smell a brief visit to his old life.
zh: 他擰開蓋子，嗅著酒香，像是在回味原先的生活。

en: “There’s time for that later,” Hans says, taking the bottle off him and putting it on the desk.
zh: 「一會兒有的是時間。」漢斯說，把瓶子拿過來，放在桌上。

en: Jerry reaches back into the hole and the second thing he pulls out is the gun.
zh: 傑瑞又把手伸到洞里，他拿出的第二件東西是槍。

en: He holds it loosely from the base of the handle, the way someone would handle it if they were surrendering to an Armed Offenders Unit.
zh: 他輕輕地握住槍把，就像某人向武裝罪犯調查人員繳械投降那樣。

en: For a moment he can remember sitting on the floor next to Sandra. He’s spinning the chamber of the gun like they do when playing Russian roulette.
zh: 此時，他已經清楚地記得自己坐在桑德拉旁邊的地板上，他正在旋轉槍的彈膛，就像在玩俄羅斯輪盤。

en: He flicks the latch with his thumb and the cylinder opens out to the left.
zh: 他用拇指撥動彈筒栓，彈筒向左打開。

en: Each of the holes are full, but one of the bullets is only a casing, the contents of that casing having ended up inside his wife.
zh: 每個筒里都有子彈，但只有一個子彈只有彈殼，彈頭已經射進他妻子的身體。

en: Hans reaches over his shoulder and takes the gun off him.
zh: 漢斯將手伸過他的肩膀，從他手裡接過槍。

en: Don’t trust Hans.
zh: 「不要相信漢斯。」

en: Probably worried Jerry is going to turn it on himself.
zh: 他可能是擔心傑瑞會把槍對準他自己。

en: “Keep looking,” Hans says.
zh: 「繼續找啊。」漢斯說。

en: He keeps looking.
zh: 他接著往裡看。

en: This time his fingers close on the journal.
zh: 這一次，他的指尖觸碰到日記了。

en: He looks at the cover, at the smiley face Eva drew, the eyes glued to the cover, one of them foggy, one of them clear.
zh: 他把它拿在手上，看著封面，上面是伊娃畫的笑臉，眼睛是粘上去的，一個霧蒙蒙的，另一個很清晰。

en: Dad’s coolest ideas is written neatly above the face, The Captain Goes Burning on the spine.
zh: 臉的上方整齊地寫著「爸爸最酷的想法」，書脊上寫著「燃燒的船長」。

en: He opens the cover, and there are his words, words from another life filling the pages.
zh: 他打開日記，看到了他寫的文字，整頁整頁的文字訴說著另一種生活。

en: “It’s really here,” he says.
zh: 「真的在這裏。」他說。

en: “Let me take a look,” Hans says, and reaches back over.
zh: 「讓我看看。」漢斯說著，伸出手。

en: But Jerry doesn’t hand it over. Instead he clutches it to his chest.
zh: 但傑瑞沒有給他，而是把它貼在自己的胸口。

en: When he looks back at Hans he sees his friend looking annoyed, and for a moment, the briefest of moments, there is something in Hans’s face, something that reminds Jerry that Hans always seemed to know the dark side even better than his darkest characters. Then Hans smiles.
zh: 他回頭看看漢斯，漢斯很是惱火，有那麼一個瞬間，漢斯臉上露出一個怪異的表情，這表情在提醒傑瑞，漢斯是了解黑暗的一面的，比他塑造的最陰險、最惡毒的人物都要了解。

en: Jerry realizes he’s being silly, and that everything is okay.
zh: 漢斯笑了笑，傑瑞忽然覺得自己很愚蠢，現在一切正常。

en: “Please, Jerry,” Hans says.
zh: 「拜託，傑瑞。」漢斯說，「我覺得最好還是讓我看看。

en: You’re too close to it. Too emotional. I can give you the truth in a nicer way.”
zh: 我可以以一種更好的方式讓你了解真相。」

en: Jerry decides that Hans is right, that he won’t try to twist the journal into the best possible nonguilty narrative the way Jerry would.
zh: 傑瑞覺得漢斯說得對，他不會像傑瑞那樣試圖把日記扭曲成無罪的證據。

en: Hans carries the journal over to the couch and sits down, the phone going with him, not leaving a lot of light for Jerry.
zh: 漢斯拿著日記走近沙發，坐下，手機拿在他手上，傑瑞那裡就沒有多少光亮了。

en: Jerry reaches back into the cavity and finds the flash drives.
zh: 傑瑞又把手伸進空洞，找到快閃記憶體盤。

en: Then his hand touches something long and cold, and he adjusts his grip and puts his fingers around it.
zh: 接著，他的指尖觸摸到了一個長長的、冰冰的東西，他調整了一下姿勢，用手握住它。

en: It’s a knife, no doubt the one used to kill the florist.
zh: 這是一把刀，毫無疑問，是用來殺死花店老闆的那把刀。

en: An image flashes through his mind, of Sandra picking up his jacket and finding the blade in the pocket.
zh: 一幅畫面閃過了他的腦海：桑德拉抓起他的外套，發現了口袋裡的刀。

en: It begs the question—if there is going to be a tactile link to a memory, why one that pales in significance to him being a murderer?
zh: 這裏出現了一個問題：如果他還有記憶的連接，那麼為什麼所有的跡象都指向他，顯示他是一個殺人兇手？

en: Why does picking up the knife remind him of Sandra finding it, when picking up the gun reminds him of nothing?
zh: 為什麼一拿起刀就會想到桑德拉發現了它，而拿起槍就沒有任何記憶呢？

en: Eric was drugging him to cover up the murders he committed.
zh: 艾瑞克給他注射鎮靜劑來掩飾他的謀殺罪。

en: But what about Suzan with a z, Sandra, and the florist?
zh: 但蘇姍、桑德拉和花店老闆又是怎麼回事呢？

en: No. There’s more going on here, Henry says.
zh: 「不，還有更多。」亨利說，「繼續尋找，你找到了你的日記，但我的還在那裡。」

en: Was Henry keeping a journal too?
zh: 亨利還寫日記？

en: He puts the knife on the edge of the desk and goes back to the hole. He closes his hand around some loose pages.
zh: 他把刀放在桌邊，回頭繼續摸索，他抓到了一些零散的紙片。

en: You always thought Sandra was stealing them, Henry says.
zh: 「你一直認為是桑德拉偷了它們。」亨利說。

en: But it wasn’t Sandra, it was his alter ego, the man who makes bad things happen.
zh: 但並不是桑德拉，是他的另一個自我，那個作惡多端的人。

en: That’s what they pay me for.
zh: 「這就是他們給我的。」

en: He sits in the office chair. He turns on the desk lamp, not caring if anybody sees the light from outside, and Hans doesn’t seem to care either because he doesn’t say anything. He seems too engrossed with the Madness Journal.
zh: 他坐在辦公椅上，打開檯燈，並不在乎外面是否有人看到燈光，漢斯也不在乎了，因為他沉默無言地沉浸在了「狂人日記」當中。

en: Jerry begins to read.
zh: 傑瑞開始讀那些紙片了。

en: It may be his handwriting, but they are definitely not his words.
zh: 這應該是他的筆跡，但上面寫的絕對不是他的話。

en: They are the words of Henry Cutter.
zh: 是亨利·卡特的話。
